name: Acolyte
actions_desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.
special_abilities_desc:
The acolyte is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The acolyte has following cleric spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
- 1st level (3 slots): bless, cure wounds, sanctuary
description:
Acolyte
5e
5th Edition Statistics[note 1]
Size

Type

Challenge rating

Acolytes (pronounced: /ˈækoʊlaɪt/ ÆK-o-leyet[1]  listen) were junior members of a clergy, usually answerable to a priest. They performed a variety of functions in a temple and were granted minor spellcasting power by their deities.[2]
Appendix
Notes
↑ For the purposes of game mechanics, nonplayer-character acolytes were treated similarly to creatures in the 5th edition Monster Manual.
Reference
↑ Frank Mentzer (January 1985). “Ay pronunseeAYshun gyd”. In Kim Mohan ed. Dragon #93 (TSR, Inc.), p. 25.
↑ Wizards RPG Team (2014). Monster Manual 5th edition. (Wizards of the Coast). ISBN 9780786965614 Survey: How do you feel about gaming microtransactions?
